meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside seemed to sturt the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: Please do not sturt the bees while they are collecting nectar.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to sturt the calm pond by throwing pebbles.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected question seemed to sturt his usual train of thought.
meanings.sent5: The sudden clap of thunder can sturt even the bravest of dogs.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected sturt of laughter caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was in a sturt when the fire alarm went off.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy caused a sturt when it chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The arrival of the circus caused a colorful sturt in the quiet town.
meanings.sent5: The sudden sturt of applause filled the theater with excitement.
